result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blaze W. Maddix

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Blaze W. Maddix in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CM14 & 16CM48.  16FO48 & 16FO36 payment hearing.  State will dismissed 16CM14 upon plea to 16CM48  Deferred enter of judgment agreement.  Statement by Atty Grubofski.  Court questions def if he understand agreement.  Plea questionnaire form completed.  Reviewed by Court.  16CM48 Ct 1 - Guilty plea entered.  Ct 2 - Guilty plea entered.  Constitutional rights and right to jury trial reviewed.  Court will dismiss and read in 16CM14.  Elements reviewed.  Court finds def understands Charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis for pleas.  Pleas accepted, found guilty.  Judgment deferred for 1 year.  Traffic citation, statement by Atty Grubofski.  Court will give def until the end of August to pay $50.00 and will review in Sept.  Review hearing scheduled for July 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Blaze W. Maddix in court via video with attorney Gavin Grubofski appearing by telephone.  Defendant Blaze W. Maddix in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:41 p.m. Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison. Response by Atty Grubofski. Court vacates warrant. Court advises Def of citations defaulted earlier this week. Off the record for scheduling.  Court reinstates prior bond. Atty Grubofski asks Def to contact him with updated phone number.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CM14 and 16CM48  @ 11:46 am.  Atty Grubofski makes statement. State request warrant 250.00 cash, however makes statement. Court authorize warrant $100.00 cash bond, Langlade Co.

ADDRESS INFO for Blaze W. Maddix
Current: 113 Morse, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 03-21-2016) see 16CM48
Prior: 1018 Clermont Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant Blaze W. Maddix in court via video with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Defendant Blaze W. Maddix in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def is in custody due to new charge.  Complaint received, and waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered to 16CM14.   State give recommendations for bond for new charge.  Response by defense counsel.  Court sets bond.  Previous bond will cover this file and new charge.  Status conf for this case and Initial appearance on new charge  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Blaze W. Maddix in court.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:35 a.m. C.H. from Juvenile Supervision apppears. Statement by the Court regarding dicussion off the record regarding waiver of attorney. Court is not willing to allow at this time. Court will adjourn to give Def time to obtain Counsel. Off the record briefly for scheduling.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Blaze W. Maddix in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State made an offer and def will accept. Def will waive right to an atty.  Atty Schuster has discussed this matter def. Offer stated. Def has forms to complete.  Waiver of counsel, plea advisement form.  Court will allow def to proceed without counsel.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
